t: Isaiah 41
Israel Encouraged
“Coastlands,*pn listen to Me in silence, And*ln let the peoples gain new strength; Let*ln them come forward, then let them speak; Let*ln us come together for judgment.

Who*ln has aroused one from the east Whom*ln He calls in righteousness to His feet? He*ln delivers up nations before him And*ln subdues kings. He*ln makes them like dust with his sword, As*ln the wind-driven chaff with his bow.
He*ln pursues them, passing on in safety, By*ln a way he had not been traversing with his feet.
Who*ln has performed and accomplished it,*i Calling*ln forth the generations from the beginning? ‘I,*ln the Lord,*s am the first, and with the last. I am He.’ ”
The*ln coastlands have seen and are afraid; The*ln ends of the earth tremble; They*ln have drawn near and have come.
Each*ln one helps his neighbor And*ln says to his brother, “Be strong!”

So*ln the craftsman encourages the smelter, And*iln he who smooths metal*i with the hammer encourages*i him who beats the anvil, Saying*ln of the soldering, “It is good”; And*ln he fastens it with nails, So*iln that*i it will not totter.
“But*ln you, Israel, My servant, Jacob*ln whom I have chosen, Descendant*ln of Abraham My friend,
You*ln whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, And*ln called from its remotest parts And*ln said to you, ‘You are My servant, I*ln have chosen you and not rejected you.
Do*ln not fear, for I am with you; Do*ln not anxiously look about you, for I am your God. I*ln will strengthen you, surely I will help you, Surely*ln I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.’
Behold,*ln all those who are angered at you will be shamed and dishonored; Those*ln who contend with you will be as nothing and will perish.
You*ln will seek those who quarrel with you, but will not find them, Those*ln who war with you will be as nothing and non-existent.
For*ln I am the Lord*s your God, who upholds your right hand, Who*ln says to you, ‘Do not fear, I will help you.’
Do*ln not fear, you worm Jacob, you men of Israel; I*ln will help you,” declares the Lord,*s “and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.
Behold,*ln I have made you a new, sharp threshing sledge with double edges; You*ln will thresh the mountains and pulverize them,*i And*ln will make the hills like chaff.
You*ln will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away, And*ln the storm will scatter them; But*ln you will rejoice in the Lord,*s You*ln will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

“The*ln afflicted and needy are seeking water, but there is none, And*ln their tongue is parched with thirst; I,*ln the Lord,*s will answer them Myself, As*iln the God of Israel I will not forsake them.
I*ln will open rivers on the bare heights And*ln springs in the midst of the valleys; I*ln will make the wilderness a pool of water And*ln the dry land fountains of water.
I*ln will put the cedar in the wilderness, The*ln acacia and the myrtle and the olive tree; I*ln will place the juniper in the desert Together*ln with the box tree and the cypress,
That*ln they may see and recognize, And*ln consider and gain insight as well, That*ln the hand of the Lord*s has done this, And*ln the Holy One of Israel has created it.
“Present*ln your case,” the Lord*s says. “Bring*ln forward your strong arguments,”*i The*ln King of Jacob says.

Let*ln them bring forth and declare to us what is going to take place; As*ln for the former events,*i declare what they were,*i That*ln we may consider them and know their outcome. Or*ln announce to us what is coming;
Declare*ln the things that are going to come afterward, That*ln we may know that you are gods; Indeed,*ln do good or evil, that we may anxiously look about us and fear together.
Behold,*ln you are of no account, And*ln your work amounts to nothing; He*ln who chooses you is an abomination.
“I*ln have aroused one from the north, and he has come; From*ln the rising of the sun he will call on My name; And*ln he will come upon rulers as upon*i mortar, Even*ln as the potter treads clay.”

Who*ln has declared this*i from the beginning, that we might know? Or*ln from former times, that we may say, “He*i is*i right!”? Surely*ln there was no one who declared, Surely*ln there was no one who proclaimed, Surely*ln there was no one who heard your words.
“Formerly*ln I*i said*i to Zion, ‘Behold, here they are.’ And*ln to Jerusalem, ‘I will give a messenger of good news.’
But*ln when I look, there is no one, And*ln there is no counselor among them Who,*ln if I ask, can give an answer.
Behold,*ln all of them are false; Their*ln works are worthless, Their*ln molten images are wind and emptiness.
